intro: Microsaccus affinis, commonly known as the common microsaccus, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Microsaccus affinis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
